title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No 13. of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Galway County
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Galway County 

Council) (Rate Limitation) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited valuation act 2001 (galway county council) (rate limitation) order 2023

title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No 13. of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: 2. Galway County Council shall exercise its powers to make such rates in
text_raw:
2. Galway County Council shall exercise its powers to make such rates in 
such a manner as to secure that the total amount liable to be paid to it in respect 
of rates made by it for the local financial year 2024 does not exceed an amount 
determined in accordance with the formula set out in section 56(2) of the 
Valuation Act 2001, where “A” is the figure 1.064 and where “G” is 
€2,068,315. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 14 November 2023 

KIERAN O’DONNELL, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local Government 

and Heritage 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 17th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [554] 3

title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No 13. of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order requires that Galway County Council, in exercising its powers to 
make rates for the financial year 2024, does so in such a way to ensure that the 
total amount of rates liable to be paid to it does not exceed an amount 
determined in accordance with the formula as set out in section 56(2) of the 
Valuation Act 2001. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [554]
